properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms are expected to develop along a cold front this afternoon or evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with wind gusts of 90 km/h and nickel sized hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-08-05T05:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-04T19:05:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3813689752.2019
Area: Sachigo Lake - Bearskin Lake, Big Trout Lake - Kasabonika, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and locally reduced visibilities at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. When outdoors, if your breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce strenuous physical activities. If you experience irritation of eyes, nose or throat, shortness of breath or other respiratory symptoms, you should take action to reduce your exposure to smoke. If you are feeling unwell and experiencing symptoms, contact your health care provider for advice. Issued jointly by Environment Canada and the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services. For more information on air quality and your health, please visit the Northwest Territories Department of Health and Social Services at www.hss.gov.nt.ca/en/services/environmental-health/air-quality. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-08-05T09:37:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services, 2019-08-04T17:38:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3879558375.2019
Area: Wrigley Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times is expected. An intense low pressure system continues to give rain to Kivalliq this afternoon. The rain will taper off at Arviat this evening and elsewhere by Monday morning. Showers will persist off and on Monday and Monday night in all areas, however amounts will be relatively light. Arviat has reported 24 mm in the past 24 hours or so, with around 5 mm more expected before the rain tapers off this evening. Whale Cove and Rankin Inlet have had around 10 to 15 mm of rain since Saturday afternoon, with another 10 to 20 mm forecast for tonight and lesser amounts on Monday. Baker Lake has reported 15 to 20 mm of rain since Saturday morning. A further 5 to 10 mm is expected tonight with lesser amounts forecast for Monday. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T11:44:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-04T19:45:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1063758500.2019
Area: Baker Lake, Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hot and humid conditions continue this evening. A cold front tonight is expected to bring a cooler airmass to the area Monday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T11:30:47-00:00
